definition: A &%SetOrClass is a &%MutuallyDisjointClass just in case there exists nothing which is an instance of all of the instances of the original &%SetOrClass.
opposite_reasoning: OverlappingClass provides the strongest logical opposition to MutuallyDisjointClass. The defining property of MutuallyDisjointClass is that ∃x: ∀C∈S → ¬(x∈C) (no instance belongs to all member classes). OverlappingClass would capture the negation: ∃x: x∈C₁ ∧ x∈C₂ for some pair of classes (instances share membership). This binary opposition (overlap vs. no overlap) creates a clean semantic axis for Fisher-LDA. For AI safety monitoring, distinguishing between disjoint categorizations and overlapping/ambiguous categorizations could be relevant for detecting category confusion or conceptual blending in AI reasoning.
